name: Gratiola
Relationship: Compare: DIG.; EUPH.; TAB.; CHAM.; AMMON. PIC.; NUX-VOM.

Head: Eyes dry, burn
Myopia
Tightness in forehead, with wrinkles in skin
Sick headache
Sensation as if brain was contracting and head became smaller
RUSH OF BLOOD with vanishing of sight
Stomach: Dyspepsia, with much distention of the stomach
Cramps and colic after supper and during night, with swelling of abdomen and constipation
Vertigo during and after meals; hunger and feeling of emptiness after meals
Stool: Diarrhoea; GREEN, FROTHY WATER, followed by anal burning, FORCIBLY EVACUATED WITHOUT PAIN
Female: Menses too profuse, premature, and too long

details: Acts especially on gastrointestinal tract. Chronic catarrhal conditions, leucorrhoea and gonorrhea. Obstinate ulcers. Useful in mental troubles from overweening pride. Especially useful in females. Nux symptoms in females often met by Gratiola.
